Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: glazed black, with part of tondo border of three lines and dot band preserved; exterior: on lip, black-figure decoration consisting of two facing feet on a narrow black band; glazed wall below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Williams suggests that the vase was dedicated by Aristophantos who also left numerous dedications on Chian chalices both at Naukratis and at Aegina.
Bibliographic references: Brijder 1983a / Siana Cups I and Komast Cups (p. 240, no. 51) (Middle Period C-Painter)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 372, no. B505)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 229, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0382) (Phase 1)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 184 note 54)
